subject: Education
title: Open Educational Resources: Free Textbooks for All
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Open Educational Resources: Free Textbooks for All.

hook.text: College textbooks cost $1,200 per year. Open Educational Resources offer the same content for free.

buildup.text: MIT started it in 2001 by posting all course materials online. OpenStax now provides free textbooks to millions.

discovery.text: Studies show students using OER perform as well or better than those with expensive textbooks.

twist.text: Publishers fought back hard, bundling access codes that force students to buy new editions every year.

climax.text: OER proves that knowledge doesn't have to be locked behind a paywall. The fight is over who controls access.

punchline.text: The best textbook is the one every student can afford.

quiz.question: What university pioneered open course materials in 2001?
